title: Low-pressure area over Southwest Arabian Sea not to impact any coastal area: PMD
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 20 (APP): The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) Friday said that the well-marked low-pressure area prevailing over Southwest Arabian Sea will not impact any coastal area of Pakistan.
According to the PMD’s Cyclone Warning Centre, Karachi, a well-marked low-pressure area (strong weather system) was lying over Southwest Arabian Sea at around Latitude 9.5 °N and Longitude 61.5 °E at a distance of about 1810km southwest of Karachi and 1750 km south of Gwadar.
Due to favorable environmental conditions, the system is likely to intensify further into a Depression and move in west/northwest direction towards Oman-Yemen coast. None of the Pakistan coastal area is likely to be impacted by the system, the PMD’ Centre said.
